title: [BUG] AzureBlobArtifactRepository.list_artifacts() wrong

labels.name: area/uiux
labels.description: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server

labels.name: area/docker
labels.description: Docker use anywhere, such as MLprojects and MLmodels

body:
### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **OS Platform and Distribution (Mac/Linux/Docker)**:
- **MLflow version (1.9.0/1.8.0)**:
- **Python version(3.6/3.7/3.8)**:
- **SetUp AzureStorage**:

### Describe the problem
Azure Storage aritficats can't download from UI,  in 1.8.0 and 1.9.0 Version, because all AzureBlobArtifactRepository get list method is wrong. 

    def list_artifacts(self, path=None):

alwary return files >=1, even the path is a file. It can impact is_directory method

    class ArtifactRepository:
        def _is_directory(self, artifact_path):
        listing = self.list_artifacts(artifact_path)
        return len(listing) > 0
In the end, in azure download file, in backend, always create direction instead of file name in ArtifactRepository.py abastract class.

    if self._is_directory(artifact_path) 
        return download_artifact_dir(artifact_path)
    else:
        return download_file(artifact_path)

@Asgeir Berland <asgeir.berland@gmail.com>, in this commit. Maybe something broken this logic https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/2594

### Code to reproduce issue

 1. install azure-storage-blob==12.3.2 and mlflow==1.9.0
 2. Set up AZURE_STORAGE_ARTIFACT in env
 3. Set up AZURE_STORAGE_ACCESS_KEY in env
 4. `mlflow server \
    --backend-store-uri /yourdisk \
    --default-artifact-root $AZURE_STORAGE_ARTIFACT/ \
    --host 0.0.0.0`
  
 5. Training once and try to download the artifact from one of your experiments http://localhost:5000/#/experiments/1

### Other info / logs
Get Artifact
    http://localhost:5000/get-artifact?path=random-forest-model%2Fmodel.pkl&run_uuid=79379700d86e45cd8aac1a33ebc7c651

Error Display

      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 182, in get_artifact_handler
        return send_file(filename, as_attachment=True)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/flask/helpers.py", line 629, in send_file
        file = open(filename, "rb")
    IsADirectoryError: [Errno 21] Is a directory: '/var/folders/h6/0s1kkw2n18z9l2m3l_n9gsfm0000gn/T/tmpb2aw2uu1/random-forest-model/model.pkl'


### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this bug affect?
Components 
- [x] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for
Model Registry
- [x] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: Local serving, model deployment tools, spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

Interface 
- [x] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, JavaScript, plotting
- [x] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

Language 
- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients

Integrations
- [x] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations
